issues.summary: [Technical Debt] Refactor how calculate prices is used to avoid 429 errors
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*User Story / Description:*

After investigation in [https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/RTEVMS-2113|https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/RTEVMS-2113|smart-link]  , we identified the 429 has been consistent, even though it’s not happening for all the customers, there is evidence that this error can impact the conversion and customer experience.

For further details, please review the context and evidence on [https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Zjz9iL6NWmPVaVmtW9hZOvSGEJvtNuBbNgX7jVDgJtc/edit?tab=t.0|https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Zjz9iL6NWmPVaVmtW9hZOvSGEJvtNuBbNgX7jVDgJtc/edit?tab=t.0|smart-link] 

Some ideas are:

* Migrate /gw/calculate endpoint to /gw/calculate/prospect/batch and optimize calculation calls: (/) 
* Review and optimize caching strategies for price and voucher data ⏲️ 
* Implement robust error handling and user feedback for voucher and price services ⏲️ 
* Establish long-term monitoring and alerting for conversion-critical endpoints and error rates ⏲️ 


{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*Acceptance Criteria:*

* Refactor the codebase to utilize the /gw/calculate/prospect/batch endpoint for grouped calculation calls, similar to other brands like Factor and HelloFresh. This aims to reduce the overall number of API requests to the calculation service.
* Evaluate existing caching mechanisms, particularly in the context of the /gw/calculate endpoint and the issues observed with "Disable cache" during replication. Optimize caching to reduce unnecessary API calls and improve performance without causing stale data issues.
* Implement comprehensive monitoring in tools like HoneyComb to track error rates (specifically 429s and 403s) for /gw/calculate, /factorform/products, and other critical conversion endpoints over a longer period (e.g., 6 months). Set up alerts for significant increases in error rates.

* *Affected Brands:*

Factor Form VMS
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*Developer Notes:*

* According to [HoneyComb|h

issues.summary: Feeding guide header
Add E2E tests
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
Let’s add some E2E tests to make sure our feeding guide works properly.
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
Test cases:

* Navigating from dashboard to the feeding guide
** Assert the meal selection from the dashboard match the feeding instructions in the feeding guide based on the recipe type (FR, DR, MX)
* Landing directly on {{/feeding-guide}} logged in with a valid subscription
** Assert the user is redirected to {{/feeding-guide/{week}}} with the correct next deliverable week
** Assert the meal selection from that week match the feeding instructions in the feeding guide based on the recipe type (FR, DR, MX)
* Landing directly on {{/feeding-guide}} NOT logged in with a valid subscription
** Assert the user is redirected to log-in
** After logging in, assert the user is redirected back to feeding guide
** Assert the meal selection from that week match the feeding instructions in the feeding guide based on the recipe type (FR, DR, MX)
{panel}

issues.summary: [Bug] Express Checkout shows Place Order button disabled

comments.author: Edwin Torres
comments.body: I found the issue was related to the {{shippingAddressId}} , because this field is required for {{OTP}} and previously we didn’t need it for {{subscriptions}} on {{express checkout}}

comments.author: Edwin Torres
comments.body:
For the payment method_nonce, I was investigating if we could get the {{method_nonce}} on the {{express checkout}} but we can only get the {{savedMethodId}} , which is incorrect for the value expected in API’s contract.  [https://github.com/hellofresh/orders-processing-service/blob/master/internal/service/checkout/v1/service.go#L44|https://github.com/hellofresh/orders-processing-service/blob/master/internal/service/checkout/v1/service.go#L44]

issues.summary: [OTP] [UAT] Shipping date inconsistency
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*Description:*

The shipping date differs between Success modal (Jan 14) and my dashboard (Jan 16)

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Place an OTP order
# Check the success modal
# compare it with my dashboard
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*Expected result:*

The same shipping date should show up.

*Testing Requirements:*

Live
{panel}



{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*Actual result:*

Different dates are shown:


Success modal shows Jan 14

!Screenshot 2026-01-14 at 10.17.16-20260114-151721.png|width=643,height=528,alt="Screenshot 2026-01-14 at 10.17.16-20260114-151721.png"!

Dashboard shows Jan 16

!image-20260114-152941.png|width=50%,alt="image-20260114-152941.png"!
{panel}

issues.summary: [OTP] Get and show active customer orders history with OTP
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*User Story / Description:*

As a customer I want to see my OTP orders on /factorform/settings/orders 
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*Acceptance Criteria:*

*Testing Requirements:*

* Verify if OTP orders are properly billed
* Verify if SNS orders are properly billed
* Verify if both type of orders are billed after I did my first order and order a different type of order.

*Affected Brands:* 

* Factor Form VMS
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*Accessibility Requirements:*
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*Developer Notes:*

* Endpoint: [http://localhost:3000/gw/api/customers/me/orders?country=FJ&limit=100&locale=en-US|http://localhost:3000/gw/api/customers/me/orders?country=FJ&limit=100&locale=en-US]
* whitelabel-web/packages/pages/settings/src/components/OrderHistory/OrderHistory.tsx 
{panel}



*References*:

*Manage Subscriptions:* 

* What to show when a customer does not have any subscription?

!image-20251128-212434.png|width=1153,height=1129,alt="image-20251128-212434.png"!



*Order History*

* Currently OTP orders are not shown

!image-20251128-212532.png|width=1267,height=1015,alt="image-20251128-212532.png"!
